intro: Basonca longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered basonca, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated floral structures. The plant typically features compound leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
